grading_instructions.title: Plagiarism
grading_instructions.description: You plagiarised the slide. We noted it down and will reserve us the right to exclude you from the bonus
examples: The student copied the definition of coupling and cohesion directly from the lecture slides without paraphrasing.

grading_instructions.title: Assessment of the Difference between Coupling/Cohesion
grading_instructions.description: You correctly explained the difference between coupling and cohesion, well done!
examples: The student explained that cohesion refers to the internal dependencies within a subsystem, while coupling refers to the dependencies between different subsystems.

grading_instructions.title: Assessment of the Difference between Coupling/Cohesion
grading_instructions.description: You provided the correct difference, however you did not explain it
examples: The student stated that coupling is about dependencies between subsystems and cohesion is about dependencies within a subsystem, but did not elaborate further.

grading_instructions.title: Assessment of the Difference between Coupling/Cohesion
grading_instructions.description: You did not provide a correct explanation of the difference between coupling and cohesion
examples: The student confused the definitions, stating that cohesion is about dependencies between subsystems and coupling is about dependencies within a subsystem.

grading_instructions.title: Assessment of the Explanation why Coupling/Cohesion are important
grading_instructions.description: You correctly explained why coupling and cohesion are important, well done!
examples: The student articulated that high cohesion and low coupling lead to easier maintenance and adaptability of the system.

grading_instructions.title: Assessment of the Explanation why Coupling/Cohesion are important
grading_instructions.description: Your explanation of why the terms are important is incorrect, please review the lecture slides again and ask your tutor if something is still unclear
examples: The student claimed that coupling and cohesion are not important for system design, which is incorrect.

grading_instructions.title: Assessment of the Example
examples: The student provided a unique example of a software development team where high cohesion is seen in team members working closely together, while low coupling is illustrated by their independence from other teams.

grading_instructions.title: Assessment of the Example
grading_instructions.description: Correct but a weak example. Be more creative with your examples and explain them in more detail!
examples: The student used a generic example of a project team, which was similar to the one discussed in the lecture slides, without adding new insights.

grading_instructions.title: Assessment of the Example
grading_instructions.description: You did not provide an example for coupling and cohesion. Please reiterate over your submission and ask your tutor if something is still unclear
examples: The student failed to include any example related to coupling and cohesion in their submission.
